[Link](http://www.hetzner.de/en/hosting/produkte_rootserver/st34) http://www.hetzner.de/en/hosting/produkte_rootserver/st34 
Hetzner: i7-3770 32 GB RAM 2x3TB 200Mbps for €34 (incl VAT)
Extra IPs are €1 each. 

I dont know public opinion about Hetzner (old hardware, etc), for me it is acceptable. I ordered 1 server yesterday and 1 more today. I actually need the disk space.. and I realize it might be overkill for most.. but its great for me. 

Since VAT doesnt apply to me, my invoice automatically excludes VAT.. so for US$36 (no setup fee), this is excellent deal. (Only thing better would have been having same offer in US)

In my scenario, I prefer Raid-0 in CentOS 6.5. Sharing my steps for the rare person who needs the same:

STEP 1: Boot to rescue, delete old partitions and move to MBR to GPT

    dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/sda bs=512 count=1
    dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/sdb bs=512 count=1
    sgdisk -R /dev/sdb /dev/sda

STEP 2: Boot to VNC, and perform a GUI based CentOS installation. Now CentOS can be used with Raid-0
